data.text: @Zwelilunge Also just because something is found on Google does not make it a fact. You can literally type in "horse with wings and you will find articles on it claiming to be true.

@Zwelilunge Unfortunately you can't move the goalposts for him. He said it prevents & cures. & provided no evidence for this claim. No clinical trials etc.just his word. Citing 500 dead people as evidence of a cure is strange & ironic honestly.

@Zwelilunge Rajoelina (president) stated, on April 29th at the AU teleconference that it was prevents & cures covid19. He distributed it to thousands of school children as preventative measure. Why would he distribute it to negative kids if not for prevention?
@teamSA4eva Also, just type on google the number of cases Madagascar has. And the second frame picture is from this article https://t.co/N5vX8S0yeV.

@teamSA4eva First, the herbal treatment does not prevent Covid 19, it cures it so you can still get  Covid 19. Hence, they had an increase in cases. But as you can see the cases are really low and their death count is barely over 500 because they’ve been using the herbal tea.

@Zwelilunge They were calling for international help a couple of monthd ago and their hospitals were overwhelmed, they declared a state of emergency and even a curfew. Despite their miracle working tea that supposedly prevents covid19. Also cite your sources for these facts
